content:
• Wednesday, May 14, 2014
  • CLVS

    Clovis +8.6% AH, Dendredon +1.9% on positive ASCO data

    • Clovis (NASDAQ:CLVS) and Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) have both presented abstracts ahead of the American Society of Clinical Oncology's (OTC:ASCO) May 30-June 3 annual meeting.
    • Clovis is presenting five abstracts related  to Phase 1/2 studies for three of its compounds, including CO-1686 (aims to treat non-small cell lung cancer).
    • Dendreon is presenting two abstracts related to a phase 2 study and Proceed registry data for its Provenge prostate cancer immunotherapy.
    • ASCO abstract search
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 PM

  • After hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: VIPS +8.0%. CSCO +7.1%. DANG +4.0%. DNDN +3.7%. SYMC +3.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: XONE -12.4%. VOXX -5.6%. SIR -4.2%. FUEL -2.8%. NBG -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • XONE

    ExOne -12.8% AH on Q1 miss, margin pressure

    • Though ExOne (NASDAQ:XONE) is reiterating guidance for 2014 revenue of $55M-$60M (consensus is at $57M), the Street's reaction to the company's big Q1 miss suggests it's highly skeptical.
    • 2014 gross margin guidance has been lowered to 40%-43% from 43%-46%. SG&A, R&D, and capex guidance (previous) has been reiterated.
    • Only 3 printers were sold in Q1, down from 12 in seasonally strong Q4 and 5 a year ago. 1 high-end S-Max printer was sold vs. 3 in Q4 and 2 a year ago.
    • One bright spot: Sales of 3D-printed products, materials, and other services rose 32% Y/Y to $4.9M.
    • Gross margin fell to 22.2% from 30.9% in Q4 and 35.8% a year ago. ExOne says development costs related to its ExCast (aims to cover each part of the additive manufacturing process for industrial clients) hurt GM.
    • SG&A spend rose 46% Y/Y to $5.2M. R&D spend rose 115%, but still only totaled $1.8M.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • TNDM

    Tandem jumps on upgrade

    • Shares of thinly-traded Tandem Diabetes Care (TNDM +11.9%) pop on turnover of 250K shares after Deutsche Bank raises its rating from Hold to Buy with a $25 PT (down from $28). In March, Sterne Agee initiated coverage with a Neutral rating and $25 PT.
    • Consensus revenue targets for Q2 and Q3 are $11M and $14.1M, respectively.
    • Consensus views for 2014 and 2015 revenues are $51.7M and $83.6M, respectively.
    • Since its debut in November 124 mutual funds have bought in.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop +10.7% AH on Q1 beat, guidance; Dangdang +4%

    • Vipshop (NYSE:VIPS) expects Q2 revenue of  $780M-$790M, far above a $685.6M consensus and good for 118% Y/Y growth at the midpoint.
    • Gross margin rose 40 bps Q/Q and 150 bps Y/Y to 24.9%. Opex rose 115% Y/Y (compares with rev. growth of 125.9%), thanks to 97.8%, 129%, 134.8%, and 146.1% respective increases in fulfillment, marketing, tech/content, and G&A spend.
    • Active customers rose by 1.7M Q/Q and 5.6M Y/Y to 7.4M. Total orders rose by 2.5M Q/Q and 11.4M Y/Y to 20.2M.
    • Chinese e-commerce peer Dangdang (NYSE:DANG) is following Vipshop higher; the company reports tomorrow morning. JD.com (NASDAQ:JD), which just set its IPO price range, has to be pleased with the Street's reaction to Vipshop's numbers.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • OPWR

    Opower beats by $0.10, beats on revenue

    • Opower (NYSE:OPWR): Q1 EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $28.6M (+50% Y/Y) beats by $2.71M.
    • Shares +4.11% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco +7% after better-than-expected guidance, order data

    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) guides on its FQ3 CC for FQ4 revenue to be down 1%-3% Y/Y; that's favorable to a -5.2% consensus.
    • In addition, John Chambers states Cisco's product orders were "relatively flat" Y/Y, a marked improvement from FQ2's 4% drop. Book-to-bill was "comfortably above 1."
    • Strong U.S. (+7% Y/Y) and Northern European (+4%) orders provided a lift. Emerging markets (-7%) and service provider (-5%) orders remain soft.
    • Router revenue fell 10%, but orders were nearly flat. Switch sales fell 6%.
    • FQ3 results, details
     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • INSY

    Investors head for exits with INSY

    • Shares of Insys Therapeutics (INSY -15.7%) were down again today on a 4x surge in volume as investors continue to shy away from the controversy surrounding its Subsys marketing practices. Prices are now down 60% from the March 4 high of $57.92.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • RGSE

    RGS Energy misses by $0.19, misses on revenue

    • RGS Energy (NASDAQ:RGSE): Q1 EPS of -$0.32 misses by $0.19.
    • Revenue of $22.14M (+32% Y/Y) misses by $2.16M.
    • Shares -14.67% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • SEAS

    Sharp traffic drop at SeaWorld

    • SeaWorld (NYSE:SEAS) reports a 13% drop in traffic during Q1 with the late timing of Easter a factor.
    • The attendance drop was partially offset by a 2.2% increase in revenue per capita to $69.72.
    • Traders aren't in full panic mode over the traffic decline with Q1 repping only 12% to 15% of the company's annual revenue on average. SEAS -3.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEVO

    Gevo beats by $0.07, misses on revenue

    • Gevo (NASDAQ:GEVO): Q1 EPS of -$0.18 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $0.9M (-74.6% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M.
    • Shares +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • JACK

    Solid results from Jack In The Box, unexpected boost from queso

    • Jack In The Box (NASDAQ:JACK) reports same-store sales increased 0.7% in FQ2, boosted by a 7.2% comp for Qdoba.
    • Qdoba introduced two new queso flavors which created a mini-buzz and helped to boost store traffic.
    • The company's consolidated restaurant operating margin improved 140 bps to 18.5% during the period.
    • FQ3 same-store sales guidance: Jack in the Box +2% to +3%; Qdoba +3% to +4%.
    • JACK +0.2% AH
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • CSCO

    Cisco beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO): FQ3 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $11.54B (-5.6% Y/Y) beats by $160M.
    • Shares +3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • VIPS

    Vipshop Holdings beats by $0.17, beats on revenue

    • Vipshop Holdings (NYSE:VIPS): Q1 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.17.
    • Revenue of $701.9M (+125.9% Y/Y) beats by $51.41M.
    • Shares +6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • BLUE

    bluebird up big after Q1 report

    • Shares of bluebird bio (BLUE +27.9%) pop on a 5x surge in volume in response to its Q1 report after yesterday's close.
    • Revenue: $6.3M (+473%); operating loss: ($10.7M) (-64.6%); net loss/share: ($0.44) vs ($19.94); cash & equiv: $192.5M (-6.7%); cash burn: ($11.9M).
    • 153 mutual funds have positions, up from 73 a year earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • ZU

    Zulily jumps after lockup expires; FireEye due in a week

    • After opening lower in the wake of its lockup expiration, Zulily (ZU +9.4%) is now sharply higher. Shares had gone into trading down 56% from its February high of $73.50, thanks in part to the ugly reaction to the apparel flash sales site's Q1 EPS miss and profit outlook.
    • 110.9M shares (~90% of outstanding shares) became eligible for sale today. With over 40% of the float shorted (and many shorts holding big paper profits), short-covering is likely playing a big role in today's move.
    • Will FireEye (FEYE +1.6%) see a similar reaction following its May 21 lockup expiration? Shares are down 72% from a post-IPO high of $97.35, and over 20% of the float is shorted.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 5 Comments
  • IBM

    IBM -2% as $20 EPS target outweighed by cash flow questions

    • IBM (IBM -1.9%) execs tried to convince those at its analyst day meeting today that its business will stabilize, but apparently skepticism abounds, as shares are the weakest performer on the Dow near the close.
    • CFO Martin Schroeter reiterated IBM's EPS target for 2015 of “at least $20,” a matter that was scrutinized by the Street in reports leading up to the meeting.
    • Barclays analyst Ben Reitzes writes that the points discussed today are about as expected, but he's more concerned with cash flow than with the EPS goals; IBM's free cash flow has trended below non-GAAP EPS for the last two years, which could point toward longer term problems, and Reitzes sees $16B free cash flow guidance as challenging considering how much it must need working capital improvements to hit that figure.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 6 Comments
  • XON

    Intrexon bounces

    • Shares of Intrexon (XON +12.8%) finally bounce on a 2x surge in volume. Prices bottomed at $13.13 on May 9 representing a ~66% drop from the January 21 high of $38.50.
    • The company's market cap is still a healthy $1.8B so investors remain bullish on the stock considering its P/S ratio of 54.
    • Consensus revenue estimates for Q2 and Q3 are $9.4M and $13.5M, respectively.
    • Consensus estimates for 2014 and 2015 are EPS of $0.26 on revenues of $44.6M and EPS of $0.30 on revenues of $94.7M, respectively.
    • Since its IPO in August 139 mutual funds have bought in.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • PVCT

    Bullish price action for Provectus as uplisting approaches

    • Shares of Provectus Biopharmaceuticals (OTC:PVCT +26.4%) are up nicely on heavy volume today. The stock uplists to NYSE MKT on Friday, May 16.
    • The company has two product candidates: PV-10 for cancer and PH-10 diseases of the skin.
    • Retail investors should be careful here. The company has no revenue, four employees and ~five quarters of cash left ($16.6M) at its current burn rate of ~$3M/qtr.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 15 Comments
  • CUR

    A trader's look at Neuralstem

    • Shares of Neuralstem (CUR +9.7%) rebound off the key technical support level of the 200-day MA albeit on less-than-average volume. The $3 price point also represents a support level that was established in late January/early February.
    • The relative strength line has turned up and the RS rating remains robust at 96 (99=best possible).
    • Swing traders should consider keeping their powder dry until a high volume confirmation move takes place or it ends the week above the 10-wk EMA on higher volume. Otherwise, there is a risk the 10-wk EMA is a resistance level and prices retreat.
    • The long-term uptrend that began in April 2013 remains intact.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 7 Comments
  • LPX

    Louisiana-Pacific, Ainsworth drop tie-up plan over regulatory snag

    • Louisiana-Pacific (LPX -2.6%) and Ainsworth Lumber (OTCPK:ANSBF -15.5%) say they are terminating their planned combination.
    • LPX had warned last week of a potential legal fight with the U.S. Justice Department and Canada's antitrust regulator over required divestitures to complete the deal.
    • The companies say they mutually agreed to end the deal and that no breakup fee will be payable by either party.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGY

    Vaalco Energy -7.8% after filing $500M shelf registration

    • Vaalco Energy (EGY -7.8%) is sharply lower after it filed a shelf registration late yesterday to sell up to $500M in new stock and debt securities from time to time.
    • According to the S-3, EGY expects use any proceeds toward general corporate purposes, including paying down existing debt, potential acquisitions and capital projects as well as for working capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • TCEHY

    Tencent posts strong Q1 on mobile gaming sales, healthy user growth

    • Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY +8.4%) trades higher after reporting better than expected Q1 earnings, as net income soared 60% Y/Y to 6.46B and easily beating the analyst consensus estimate of 4.04B yuan.
    • Q1 revenues rose 36% Y/Y to 18.5B yuan; online gaming sales jumped 39%, contributing 56% of Tencent’s total revenue.
    • Mobile gaming revenue is beginning to make a significant contribution to revenue, with sales soaring 200% Q/Q to 1.8B and representing 17% of Tencent’s total gaming sales, up from 7% last quarter.
    • WeChat and QQ, the two messaging programs, claim 396M monthly active users, up 11.5% Q/Q, and the number of monthly active users for Tencent’s instant messaging service is 848M.
    • Numbers like these no doubt will help feed the anticipation for Alibaba’s (ABABA) upcoming IPO.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: SUMR +50%. PTX +30%. CLDX +26%. ARTX +24%. OTC:CACH +23%. LOJN +20%. BLUE +19%. COUP +19%. RUBI +17%. XON +15%.
    • Top 10 Losers: SUTR -29%. ENZY -27%. HYGS -23%. JGW -18%. OTC:BGMD -16%. UNTK -15%. FLL -14%. QBAK -12%. INSY -11%. EVRY -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • GUKYF

    Payment warning whacks Gulf Keystone shares

    • Gulf Keystone Energy (OTCQX:GUKYF -6.8%) warns that delays in receiving payments for exports could hold back revenues this year.
    • While Gulf Keystone confirms receipt of $6M this month as first payment for exports from its Shaikan field in the Kurdistan region of Iraq, the company sees revenues for the year of $150M-$180M, below the $230M analyst consensus estimate.
    • CEO Todd Kozel insists the persistent decline in shares is unwarranted: "We are a company producing 16.5K and on its way to producing 40K bbl/day of oil and has roughly 9.5B barrels of oil in place, but it’s a depressed share price... I scratch my head a little bit."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • SPEX

    Spherix up again today

    • Shares of pico cap Spherix (SPEX +15.7%) are up again today on an 8x surge in volume. Today's up move follows yesterday's ~13% pop on a similar volume spike. Investors appear to like the company's prospects regarding its patent infringement suit against Juniper Networks especially considering its tiny $17M market cap.
    • On a technical basis it was due for a spike. Before yesterday's move, shares were down ~96% in the three months since its August 5 high of $27.86.
    • Retail investors should tread carefully here.
    • Eight mutual funds have positions, up from six a year earlier.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games catches a bid

    • Shares of Scientific Games (SGMS +3.7%) rally in early action.
    • The company has seen some recent insider buying which could be helping to tip sentiment.
    • SEC 13D
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • STKL

    SunOpta higher after broad Q1 growth

    • Shares of SunOpta (STKL +13.6%) move higher after the company tops analyst estimates with its Q1 report.
    • The company's four key segments all saw revenue gains during the quarter.
    • Higher demand for organic raw materials Europe and North America helped to underpin SunOpta's growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • MM

    Millennial Media chief steps in with share purchase

    • President and CEO Michael Barrett purchased 291K shares of his company's tumbling stock this week at around $3.45 each. Millennial Media (NYSE:MM) is ahead 7.2% in early action to $3.81.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • PTX

    Traders like Pernix/Glaxo deal

    • Shares of Pernix Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:PTX) are up 46% premarket on heavy volume in response to its Treximet deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 1 Comment
  • ECT

    Eca Marecellus Trust tumbles after block trade

    • A 2.5M share block trade in the premarket reportedly priced at $8 per share.
    • ECT -10.2% to $7.76
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 12 Comments
  • IONS

    Positive results for Isis diabetes drug

    • Shares of Isis Pharmaceuticals (ISIS) are up 10% premarket on robust volume in response to positive data from its 75-patient Phase 2 trial for ISIS-GCGR - RX with its achievement of statistically significant reductions in measures of glucose control.
    • Absolute mean reductions in HbA1c were greater than 2% and greater than 1% in the 200mg and 100 mg cohorts compared to baseline after 13 weeks of treatment. Study subjects also experienced increased plasma GLP-1 levels.
    • ISIS-GCGR - RX improves glycemic control without causing a significant elevation in blood pressure or lipids.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: PTX +43%. TSPT +12%. CLDX +10%. ISIS +9%. URZ +7%.
    • Losers: HYGS -22%. ECT -10%. ZU -8%. FOSL -7%. USAC -6%. PLUG -6%. SNE -5%.

  • USAC

    USA Compression Partners -6.4% on news of 6.6M-unit offering

    • USA Compression Partners (NYSE:USAC) -6.4% premarket after announcing a public offering of 6.6M common units, including 1M offered by certain selling unitholders, priced at $25.59 each.
    • USAC plans to use the proceeds to reduce debt and for general partnership purposes; it will receive no proceeds from the units sold by the selling unitholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • HYGS

    Hydrogenics offering 1.5M shares at $15, shares -22% premarket

    • Hydrogenics (NASDAQ:HYGS) -21.9% premarket after announcing a public offering of 1.5M common shares from treasury (1M shares) and from selling shareholder CommScope (500K), priced at $15 each.
    • HYGS expects ~$13.7M in net proceeds from the offering but will receive no proceeds from the secondary.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 4 Comments
  • RCL

    Royal Caribbean upgraded by Suntrust

    • SunTrust Robinson Humphrey upgrades Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The investment firm has a $56 price target on shares.
    • RCL +1.0% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • PLUG

    Plug Power turns lower after Q1 report, now -7.3% premarket

    • Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG) has reversed initial gains after reporting Q1 earnings and is now -7.3% premarket.
    • Losses widened a bit and revenues fell 13% Y/Y during the quarter, but the key stat may be that PLUG shipped 165 units in Q1 vs. 238 units in Q1 2013.
    • However, PLUG has more than $80M in bookings YTD, double the bookings from 2013, which the company attributes to the successful launch of its GenKey business.
    • PLUG expects to ship more than 650 GenDrive units in Q2; targets $70M-plus in revenue for FY 2014 vs. $65M analyst consensus estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 AM | 15 Comments
  • DE

    Deere lower after cutting sales forecast

    • Q2 equipment sales of $9.246B fall from $10.265B one year ago.
    • Deere (NYSE:DE) cuts its full year sales outlook, now expecting a decline of 4% vs. a 3% fall in previous guidance.
    • The company notes farm income is expected to be lower than last year, putting pressure on demand for equipment, especially for larger models. A strong livestock market is supporting mid- and smaller-size tractors. Industry sales for ag machinery in the U.S. and Canada are expected to decline 5-10% this year.
    • Previously: Deere beats by $0.15, beats on revenue
    • Shares -1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM | 2 Comments
  • SODA

    SodaStream in focus after stumble in U.S.

    • SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) is in focus after a stumble in the U.S. drives home that the company is having some trouble penetrating the region to the same degree as other markets.
    • Guidance from SodaStream is for a FY14 revenue to increase by 15% to $647.11M vs. $639.3M consensus.
    • The company sees FY14 net income improving by 3% Y/Y to $42M.
    • What to watch: Weakness by SodaStream in the U.S. is almost sure to drive out more speculation on a major beverage player buying out the Western Europe juggernaut. Pepsico (NYSE:PEP) and Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX) top the list.
    • SodaStream earning call webcast 7:30 EST.
    • SODA -3.3% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:55 AM
  • SODA

    SodaStream fizzles after weakness in the U.S.

    • SodaStream (NASDAQ:SODA) reports a sharp drop in U.S. sales during Q1 after a "challenging" holiday set the stage for a drop in demand.
    • Sales of consumables rose 11% in Q1 to help offset a 10.8% falloff in revenue from soda maker starter kits.
    • Geographic growth: Americas -28% to $34.8M; Western Europe +17% to $62.5M; Asia-Pacific +28%; Central & Eastern Europe, Middle East, Africa +34% to $9M.
    • SodaStream's gross margin rate fell 220 bps to 52.3% due to the shift in product mix and F/X swings.
    • SODA -5.1% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM | 4 Comments

    Plug Power misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Plug Power (NASDAQ:PLUG): Q1 EPS of -$0.06 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $5.6M (-13.0% Y/Y) beats by $0.25M.
    • Shares +5.4% PM.
